content: pink ribbon tote ~ a pattern by gunilla leavitt ~ materials 4 skeins of lamb s pride bulky one pink for handles and three different colors for the bag body you can also use lamb s pride worsted or any other felting yarn hooks/needles size r tunisian crochet hook for the bulky yarn size o or p for worsted standard crochet hook or darning needle for putting bag together size 11 8mm knitting needles for handle sewing needle and thread to attach handles notes tunisian crochet tutorials are available on the web for instance at www stitchdiva com and www nexstitch com directions with first color and bulky yarn chain 30 45 or so if using worsted you can adjust this number if you want a larger or smaller bag and please remember that felting is not an exact science and that s why it s fun switch to second color and work a forward pass switch to third color and work a reverse pass there is now a strand of yarn waiting for you so grab that and work a forward pass you will be changing color by picking up the one that s waiting for you at the end of every pass work until you have a long rec- tangle mine was 18 x 36 and bind off fold the bag in half grab a crochet hook and hook together the bag on the sides by starting at the bot- tom going through a stitch reaching over to the other side and pulling a stitch through this is like chaining or picking up a dropped stitch in knitting easier to do than to explain if you prefer feel free to just sew your bag together handles with a #11 8mm needle cast on 11 sts and work wide double i-cord like this k7 bring yarn to front and slip 4 as if to purl turn repeat this until you have used up one whole skein of lamb s pride bulky 125 yds you will felt the han- dle in one piece and cut it when it s done felting throw the bag and the handle in the washer on hot wash/cold rinse until it has felted to your liking cut the handle in half fold into ribbons and attach them to your bag ta-da now show it off and consider making a donation to a breast cancer organization ©2008 gunilla godmoma leavitt gunilla@yayknitting com please email with any questions or comments
